description.plain:
Austin Agustín Santos, better known by his stage name Arcángel, is a singer and songwriter born December 23, 1985 in New York City, and eventually moved to Puerto Rico in 2002, interested in becoming a performer of reggaeton, a contemporary Latin American urban music genre. While living in Puerto Rico, he would eventually form part of a popular then-underground reggaeton act, Arcángel & De La Ghetto. The duo eventually went on to make songs that became popular among reggaeton fans in the United States and Puerto Rico, including “Agresivo”, “Sorpresa” and “Mi Fanática” during the mid-2000s.

Arcángel went on to release his debut studio album, El Fenómeno, in late 2008. The album included songs that were produced in 2008, as well as the DJ Nelson produced “Chica Virtual”, which was produced in 2007. Half of the album also included newly produced tracks, ones including “Pa' Que la Pases Bien” and “Por Amar a Ciegas”, which went on to become successful airplay songs on American Latin Urban radio stations across the United States.

body.plain:
Austin Agustín Santos, better known by his stage name Arcángel, is a singer and songwriter born December 23, 1985 in New York City, and eventually moved to Puerto Rico in 2002, interested in becoming a performer of reggaeton, a contemporary Latin American urban music genre. While living in Puerto Rico, he would eventually form part of a popular then-underground reggaeton act, Arcángel & De La Ghetto. The duo eventually went on to make songs that became popular among reggaeton fans in the United States and Puerto Rico, including “Agresivo”, “Sorpresa” and “Mi Fanática” during the mid-2000s.

Arcángel went on to release his debut studio album, El Fenómeno, in late 2008. The album included songs that were produced in 2008, as well as the DJ Nelson produced “Chica Virtual”, which was produced in 2007. Half of the album also included newly produced tracks, ones including “Pa' Que la Pases Bien” and “Por Amar a Ciegas”, which went on to become successful airplay songs on American Latin Urban radio stations across the United States.

songs.full_title: Me Acostumbré by Arcángel (Ft. Bad Bunny)
songs.title: Me Acostumbré

description.plain:
Arcángel y Bad Bunny se vuelven a unir para brindar su segunda canción juntos. La primera colaboración, “Tu No Vive Así”, también producida por DJ Luian y Mambo Kingz, fue una de las más exitosas del Trap en el 2016.

En esta canción, los artistas describen como están acostumbrados a tener una vida de éxitos, lleno dinero y mujeres. Se comparan con el número 23, que era el número de Michael Jordan durante su carrera en la NBA. El atleta apareció en el cover original, antes de que este fue cambiado.

songs.embed_content: Read “Me Acostumbré” by Arcángel on Genius

En esta canción, los artistas describen como están acostumbrados a tener una vida de éxitos, lleno dinero y mujeres. Se comparan con el número 23, que era el número de Michael Jordan durante su carrera en la NBA. El atleta apareció en el cover original, antes de que este fue cambiado.

Los topos de kush, nunca de regular
Esto e' All-Star game, tú no va' a jugar
Dando más palo' que David Ortíz
Ando con Los Beatle', loco de entrarle a tiro' a Kiss

Aceite en el vaper, ya no fumen blunt
Lo pongo a danzar kuduro, como Don

[Coro: Bad Bunny & Arcángel, Ambos]
